standard_metadata.standard_description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines, or the presence or absence of angles of a specified size. Recognize right triangles as a category, and identify right triangles.

images.alt: A triangle ABC. The angles at ABC are all acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.
###What types of angles are in $\triangle{ABC}$?   $\angle{A}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{B}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{C}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{ABC}$ has $\blueD{\text{3 acute angles}}$.
$\triangle{ABC}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle ABC. The angles at ABC are all acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.
###What types of angles are in $\triangle{ABC}$?   $\angle{A}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{B}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{C}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{ABC}$ has $\blueD{\text{3 acute angles}}$.
$\triangle{ABC}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle MNO. The angles at MNO are all acute angles.
A triangle DEF. The angle at F is obtuse. The angles at E and D are acute angles.
A triangle PRQ. The angle at P has a box at its vertex connecting lines PR and PQ. The angles at R and Q are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.
$\triangle{DEF}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\greenD{\text{1 obtuse}}$ angle, so it is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A triangle DEF. The angle at F is obtuse. The angles at E and D are acute angles.

hints.content: $\triangle{PQR}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\purpleC{\text{1 right}}$ angle, so it is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ triangle.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A triangle PRQ. The angle at P has a box at its vertex connecting lines PR and PQ. The angles at R and Q are acute angles.

images.alt: A triangle MNO. The angles at MNO are all acute angles.

hints.content: $\triangle{MNO}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A triangle MNO. The angles at MNO are all acute angles.
A triangle ABC. The angle at A has a box at its vertex connecting lines AB and AC. The angles at B and C are acute angles.
A triangle PQR. The angle at P is obtuse. The angles at Q and R are acute angles.
A triangle STU. The angles at STU are all acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.
$\triangle{ABC}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\purpleC{\text{1 right}}$ angle, so it is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ triangle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A triangle ABC. The angle at A has a box at its vertex connecting lines AB and AC. The angles at B and C are acute angles.

hints.content: $\triangle{PQR}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\greenD{\text{1 obtuse}}$ angle, so it is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A triangle PQR. The angle at P is obtuse. The angles at Q and R are acute angles.

hints.content: $\triangle{STU}$ has $\blueD{\text{3 acute}}$ angles, so it is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle.   [[☃ image 1]]

A triangle ABC. The angle at A has a box at its vertex connecting lines AB and AC. The angles at B and C are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.

###What are the measures of $\triangle{ABC}$'s angles?  $\angle{A} $ is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ angle.  $\angle{B}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{C}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{ABC}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\purpleC{\text{1 right}}$ angle.
$\triangle{ABC}$ is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle JKL. The angle at K has a box at its vertex connecting lines KJ and KL. The angles at J and L are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.

###What are the measures of $\triangle{JKL}$'s angles?  $\angle{J} $ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{K}$ is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ angle.  $\angle{L}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{JKL}$ has $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles and $\purpleC{\text{1 right}}$ angle.
$\triangle{JKL}$ is a $\purpleC{\text{right}}$ triangle.

A triangle JKL. The angle at K is obtuse. The angles at J and L are acute angles.

A triangle GHI. The angle at G is obtuse. The angles at H and I are acute angles.

hints.content: ###What are the types of triangles?  An $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ triangle has $3$ acute angles.   A  $\purpleC{\text{right}}$  triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ right angle.  An $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has $2$ acute angles and $1$ obtuse angle.

###What are the measures of $\triangle{GHI}$'s angles?   $\angle{G} $ is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ angle.  $\angle{H}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{I}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{GHI}$ has $\greenD{\text{1 obtuse angle}}$ and $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles.
$\triangle{GHI}$ is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle DEF. The angle at D is obtuse. The angles at E and F are acute angles.

###What are the measures of $\triangle{DEF}$'s angles?   $\angle{D} $ is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ angle.  $\angle{E}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.  $\angle{F}$ is an $\blueD{\text{acute}}$ angle.
$\triangle{DEF}$ has $\greenD{\text{1 obtuse angle}}$ and $\blueD{\text{2 acute}}$ angles.
$\triangle{DEF}$ is an $\greenD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.
